1{-# OPTIONS_GHC -Wall #-}
2
3-- | Simple functions for parsing command-line options.
4--   This module is based on "System.Console.GetOpt".
5
6module Koshucode.Baala.Base.IO.SimpleOption
7 ( -- * Data type
8   ShortOption, LongOption,
9   SimpleOption,
10   SimpleOption',
11   SimpleOptionDescr,
12   SimpleOptions,
13
14   -- * Option type
15   flag, opt, req,
16   getFlag, getOpt, getReq,
17
18   -- * Parsing
19   ParseResult', ParseResult,
20   parse, parseCommand,
21
22   -- * Predefined option
23   -- ** --help
24   help, helpMessage, printHelp,
25   -- ** --version
26   version, Ver.showVersion,
27 ) where
28
29import qualified Data.Maybe            as Maybe
30import qualified Data.Version          as Ver
31import qualified System.Console.GetOpt as Opt
32import qualified System.Environment    as Env
33
34
35-- --------------------------------------------  Data type
36
37-- | Single letter options, like @h@ of @-h@.
38type ShortOption = Char
39
40-- | Long name options, like @help@ of @--help@.
41type LongOption = String
42
43-- | Simple option.
44type SimpleOption = SimpleOption' LongOption
45
46-- | Simple option.
47data SimpleOption' a
48    = SimpleFlag a
49    | SimpleOpt  a (Maybe String)
50    | SimpleReq  a String
51      deriving (Show, Eq, Ord)
52
53-- | Option definition.
54type SimpleOptionDescr = Opt.OptDescr SimpleOption
55
56-- | Set of option definitions.
57type SimpleOptions = [SimpleOptionDescr]
58
59
60-- --------------------------------------------  Option type
61
62-- | Option definition for flag (switch) type.
63--
64--   > flag ['f'] ["foo"] "Echo foo"
65--
66flag :: [ShortOption] -> [LongOption] -> String -> SimpleOptionDescr
67flag short long = Opt.Option short long $ Opt.NoArg simple where
68    simple = SimpleFlag $ head long
69
70-- | Option definition with optional one parameter.
71--
72--   > opt [] ["bar"] "text" "Echo bar or text"
73--
74opt :: [ShortOption] -> [LongOption] -> String -> String -> SimpleOptionDescr
75opt short long name = Opt.Option short long (Opt.OptArg simple name) where
76    simple = SimpleOpt $ head long
77
78-- | Option definition with required one parameter.
79--
80--   > req [] ["baz"] "text" "Echo baz and text"
81--
82req :: [ShortOption] -> [LongOption] -> String -> String -> SimpleOptionDescr
83req short long name = Opt.Option short long (Opt.ReqArg simple name) where
84    simple = SimpleReq $ head long
85
86-- | Get flag of 'flag'-type option.
87getFlag :: [SimpleOption] -> LongOption -> Bool
88getFlag opts name = or $ map (getFlag1 name) opts
89
90-- | Get parameter list of 'opt'-type option.
91getOpt :: [SimpleOption] -> LongOption -> [String]
92getOpt opts name = getOpt1 name `Maybe.mapMaybe` opts
93
94-- | Get parameter list of 'req'-type option.
95getReq :: [SimpleOption] -> LongOption -> [String]
96getReq opts name = getReq1 name `Maybe.mapMaybe` opts
97
98getFlag1 :: (Eq a) => a -> SimpleOption' a -> Bool
99getFlag1 name (SimpleFlag n) = (n == name)
100getFlag1 _ _ = False
101
102getOpt1 :: (Eq a) => a -> SimpleOption' a -> Maybe String
103getOpt1 name (SimpleOpt n (Just arg)) | (n == name) = Just arg
104getOpt1 _ _ = Nothing
105
106getReq1 :: (Eq a) => a -> SimpleOption' a -> Maybe String
107getReq1 name (SimpleReq n arg) | (n == name) = Just arg
108getReq1 _ _ = Nothing
109
110
111-- --------------------------------------------  Parsing
112
113-- | Result of parsing command-line parameters, consist of
114--   (1) error message or (2) options and non-option parameters.
115type ParseResult' opt = Either [String] ([opt], [String])
116
117-- | String-type parse result.
118type ParseResult = ParseResult' SimpleOption
119
120-- | Parse parameters.
121--
122--   >>> parse [help, version] ["-h", "foo", "bar"]
123--   Right ([SimpleFlag "help"],["foo","bar"])
124--
125--   >>> parse [opt [] ["a"] "text" "optional text"] ["--a", "--a=foo", "bar"]
126--   Right ([SimpleOpt "a" Nothing, SimpleOpt "a" (Just "foo")], ["bar"])
127--
128--   >>> parse [req [] ["a"] "text" "required text"] ["--a=foo", "bar"]
129--   Right ([SimpleReq "a" "foo"], ["bar"])
130--
131parse :: SimpleOptions -> [String] -> ParseResult
132parse opts args = case Opt.getOpt Opt.Permute opts args of
133               (opts', args', err) | null err  -> Right (opts', args')
134                                   | otherwise -> Left err
135
136-- | Parse command-line parameters.
137parseCommand :: SimpleOptions -> IO ParseResult
138parseCommand opts = do args <- Env.getArgs
139                       return $ parse opts args
140
141
142-- --------------------------------------------  Predefined option
143
144-- | Predefined @-h@ or @--help@ option.
145--
146--   > flag "h" ["help"] "Show help message"
147--
148help :: SimpleOptionDescr
149help = flag "h" ["help"] "Show help message"
150
151-- | Create help message.
152helpMessage :: [String] -> SimpleOptions -> String
153helpMessage text = Opt.usageInfo (unlines text ++ "OPTION")
154
155-- | Print help message.
156printHelp :: [String] -> SimpleOptions -> IO ()
157printHelp text opts = do putStr $ helpMessage text opts
158                         putStrLn ""
159
160-- | Predefined @-V@ or @--version@ option.
161--
162--   > flag "V" ["version"] "Show version number"
163--
164version :: SimpleOptionDescr
165version = flag "V" ["version"] "Show version number"
